more description: This cozy unit is a half of a newly remodeled duplex that is situated on Shelter Cove Golf Course next to the runway and has a clear view of the Pacific Ocean. Watch planes take off and land. Enjoy beautiful sunsets from the front porch. Take a short walk to the beach. This is your ultimate retreat to get away from busy life!The spaceThis 2-story 1500 sq ft unit has an open space on the 1st floor with sitting/ TV area, dining area, half bath and a compact but well-equipped kitchen with brand new appliances. Second floor has 2 bedrooms (one with king, another with queen and twin beds) and a full bathroom with a shower. Perfect for a family of 4-5, group of friends or 2 couples. Roku TV in each bedroom to keep up with your favorite TV series and movies. Large capacity washer and dryer located in the garage. There is a set of golf clubs if you forgot yours or want to give a golfing a try, it is only 2 steps away!

more description: Unobstructed, spectacular ocean views. This house is located in the town of Shelter Cove on the Lost Coast of California. Walking distance to beaches and restaurants, this is the perfect location for your Lost Coast adventure. Plenty of parking and boat parking. Half a mile from the beach, the boat ramp and both Shelter Cove restaurants. Walk across the street to the  golf course. Or walk to the house from your plane. Watch the whales from the living room and listen to the pounding  surf.The spaceThe house has a comfortable 600+sq ft great room with panoramic views of the ocean, crashing waves and the Lost Coast.  Cook your meals on the commercial grade stove as you relax with the Pacific Ocean spreading out before you. Watch the small private planes take off and land or wave at the golfers from the bedroom windows. Spot whales, sea lions and even great white sharks from the front deck.

We kindly invite our guests to read the full listing description before booking.The spaceAs this house is on the hilltop, there are a set of stairs to access the main level of the house.  Behind the sliding barn door, the master bedroom has a private bath with a shower.  The fully equipped kitchen is set off the living room and has an island that is great for meal prep. The Master Suite Special which includes the common areas is approximately 800 square feet of living space plus a large garage and game area on the ground level. The sauna in the backyard is available for guests to use and directions for operation are located in the welcome guide inside the house.The washer and dryer are located on the ground level in the garage, along with a pool tableThe house is set apart from the other two Airbnb’s on the property and surrounded by trees, providing privacy. description: Captivating Views from a Beautiful Retreat
name: Home in Whitethorn
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Stephanie8 guests ·  · 3 bedrooms ·  · 7 beds ·  · 3 baths
number of guests: 8 guests · **__** · 3 bedrooms · **__** · 7 beds · **__** · 3 baths
more description:
Seadance is located on the Lost Coast of California in the charming oceanside community of Shelter Cove. This beautiful 3bd/3ba 2800 sf oceanfront vacation rental home offers stunning ocean views from nearly every room to help you unwind from your every day life.  Any time of year the Northern California coast is spectacular and the Seadance offers the space, views and relaxing atmosphere to immerse yourself in the glory of nature. Whether you relax to the soothing ocean sounds and/or engage iThe spaceFrom the moment you open the front door, the breathtaking ocean views will capture your attention and set the mood for a relaxing getaway.  With ocean views from nearly every room in the house, numerous amenities, lovely landscape and so much more, you will appreciate why the Seadance hosts numerous families who return year after year.

​On the main level, captivating views command your attention from the beautiful living area which has comfortable seating areas,  two full sleeper sofas, full bath and a beautiful fireplace. Also on the main level is a bedroom with a queen bed.  The kitchen is well equipped with staples on hand - including a variety of spices. 

​Upstairs the oceanfront master bedroom has a beautiful view and opens to the balcony and includes a king bed, full bath and sitting area. The third bedroom is across from the master and offers two twin XL beds.  The third bathroom is on the second level with a claw foot tub and also includes the full size washer/dryer.  

The upstairs entertainment area offers another full sofa bed, TV with Roku, DVD/VHS player, hundreds of movies, books and a pool table to challenge friends and family.  Additional card and board game entertainment can be found in the downstairs cupboard.

Off the main level is a 1000 sf patio, dining area and fire pit to enjoy watching the waves, looking for whales, searching for sea lions and other ocean loving creatures.   Want a higher ocean view, hang out on the upstairs balcony.

There are numerous activities within walking distance of Seadance - restaurants, gift and art galleries, deli, nature and fitness trails, tide pools, lighthouse, harbor beach, golf, blow hole and so much more.

description: Cozy cabin, family-friendly, with fishing, washer/dryer, patio, & WiFi
name: Cabin in Whitethorn
unit rental details: Entire cabin hosted by Vacasa California6 guests ·  · Studio ·  · 3 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 6 guests · **__** · Studio · **__** · 3 beds · **__** · 1 bath
more description:
The spaceCove Cabin RetreatPeaceful, serene, and secluded, this cabin is the greatest getaway in northern California for outdoor enthusiasts. Private, quiet, and at the end of the road, enjoy the greenery and pure adventure of the forest as you camp with your family and friends. Explore the natural trail right out the back door and experience first-hand the nature and beauty that California has to offer. On your trek, enjoy gorgeous views of the Pacific Ocean and have your breath taken away by the scenery. Enjoy listening to the sounds of the creek, whale watching at the beach, and all other waterfront activities you can think of.

Inside you'll find the all-wooden interior with comfortable furniture to rest your head on after the day's activities. The kitchenette is quaint and perfect for preparing  anything from on-the-go snacks to at-home meals. Your kids, friends, or family will love the fun loft accessible by ladder. There's WiFi in case you need to bring your work with you to your getaway in the woods, a washer/dryer on the back porch, and a tiled shower and tub to wash off the campfire at the end of the day.  This is the ultimate getaway to find peace as you're able to hear the birds, creek, and the ocean. 

THINGS TO KNOW
No dishwasher on-site. No dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.Parking notes: There is free parking for 2 vehicles. Parking: Driveway and streetSecurity camera details: AT FRONT PORCH POINTED INTO FRONT LAWN AREA.Damage waiver: The total cost of your reservation for this Property includes a damage waiver fee which covers you for up to $3,000 of accidental damage to the Property or its contents (such as furniture, fixtures, and appliances) as long as you report the incident to the host prior to checking out. More information can be found from the "Additional rules" on the checkout page.Other permit number:EXEMPT

more description: This quaint 2bd/1ba cottage is located directly off the world-famous Avenue of the Giants scenic drive which is an outstanding display of the giant redwood trees. The cottage has two decks ideally located for morning coffee/afternoon barbecues. High quality bedding in each room ensures a restful night’s sleep. The large meadow on this 5 acre property is for guest use. Gas, EV charging, coffee shop, restaurant, and groceries are available less than a mile away. Insta @redcottage_avegiantsThe spaceThis 900 square foot red cottage boasts plenty of outdoor space including two amazing decks which offer optimal sunshine and a yard all around the house, nestled against the hillside.  In addition to the deck space and green yard space, there is a large meadow located right up the drive which is ideal for picnics and playtime. The cottage has a full sized washer and dryer located in the basement for quick and easy washing.  A kitchen stocked with all the necessities (and a few snacks great for hiking) make it easy to prepare for picnics or for a quiet dinner in. The house has an on-demand hot water heater to ensure that everyone gets a hot shower! If you feel that your party may need more space, check out our other listings, Avenue of the Giants Riverview Home (3bedrooms/2baths) listing #24826740Or Pepperwood Place (2bedroom/1 bath) on the same property

Step inside, and you will be greeted by an abundance of West Coast sunshine, high-end furnishings, and an open layout that will make entertaining a breeze. Start each foggy morning with a piping hot cup of coffee on the spacious furnished deck as you plan full days of fun. The living room will be the hub for entertaining as well with a large mounted flatscreen TV, sound bar, and comfortable sofas! description: Wow! Amazing Oceanview, walk to Beach & Game room!
name: Home in Whitethorn
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Kat And Alex7 guests ·  · 3 bedrooms ·  · 5 beds ·  · 2.5 baths
number of guests: 7 guests · **__** · 3 bedrooms · **__** · 5 beds · **__** · 2.5 baths**__**Joined in July 2014**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: Nestled among tall majestic trees  sits this tri-level home in beautiful Shelter Cove ready for Guests to enjoy! This home boasts a unique design including a spiral staircase leading to each of the 3 floors, with gorgeous ocean views, and an easy 9 minute walk to Black Sands Beach. Come and experience "Whale Cove Retreat", a 3 bed, 2.5 bath  vacation haven at The Lost Coast you won't forget!The space"Whale Cove Retreat" welcomes you as you step into this beautiful 3 story home!        On the First floor,  you will find the Family room/ game room adorned with nautical themed decor. Pull up the 2 video game chairs and challenge your guests to video games with the SEGA Genesis game console.   And if you need more challenge, step outside to the attached garage where you will find the miniature ping pong table.  On this floor you will find a queen leather sleeper sofa, along with the "kids room" with a twin over full size bunk bed, and a full bathroom with tub shower.          Venture up to the Second floor and be met with spectacular ocean views ! This floor boasts a comfortable living room space, a half bath, and a fully stocked kitchen and dining that will fit your entire group.  Wake up in the  morning with a nice hot cup of coffee and enjoy nature views in the balcony.  In the afternoon, take the family outside onto the deck and BBQ a delicious meal on the easy to use propane grill while being surrounded by  sweeping views of the Pacific Ocean!  Gather together and you may catch glimpses of whale pods!  After a full meal, maybe take an afternoon nap in the  cozy patio lounger and let the sounds of the crashing waves lull you to sleep. In the evening, come inside and snuggle with a book next to the gas fireplace on those chilly nights. Or go outside, turn off all the lights and gaze up at the sky to witness the galaxy of twinkling stars.        Proceed up to the Third floor of the home where you will find the master bedroom with the cozy queen-size bed. The large window allows you to wake up and take in the gorgeous views of the Ocean! There is also an additional small private den/bedroom off to the side which houses a twin size bed in the shape of a boat . This will be a huge hit for the kids or the kid at heart! (Note you will have to walk through the master bedroom to get to this den/bedroom.)   This home is situated in a PERFECT location for exploring Shelter Cove, all within walking distance, or quick car ride. From the house, you can grab a few beach chairs and take an easy (downhill) 9 minute walk to Black Sands Beach. Or if preferred, drive or take a 20 minute leisurely stroll into town where you can get your caffeine buzz at The Fish Tank Expresso Gallery, tidepooling at Mal coombs Park,  meander to the many nature trails, or watch golfers hit a hole-in-one at the beautiful ocean front Shelter Cove Golf course.  The options are endless!    The whole house, with all the amenities, are for your use and enjoyment. This home comes with a  unique spiral staircase accessing each of the 3 floors.  Please note we do not offer baby gates so please plan accordingly if you have toddlers/ children. In the garage, we also offer a bin of outdoor toys including corntoss/bean bag toss game, spike ball, and other sports balls to play on the large park like front yard.  Beach chairs provided. There are a variety of family board games located in the living room and game room. We have left 2 sets of golf clubs for Guests to enjoy if they wish to play at Shelter Cove Golf course; an adult set and a junior set. Great for a Parent/ Child golf outing!  . Washer/ dryer in garage. Outdoor shower to rinse off by side of house. Strong WiFi in the house.  COVID 19 Cleaning practices: We are committed to AIRBNBs five-step enhanced cleaning process that goes beyond basic cleaning to sanitize the entire home.

description: Tranquil coastal-view getaway with world famous Lost Coast Trailhead
name: Home in Whitethorn
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Vacasa California8 guests ·  · 3 bedrooms ·  · 4 beds ·  · 2 baths
number of guests: 8 guests · **__** · 3 bedrooms · **__** · 4 beds · **__** · 2 baths
more description:
The spaceLost Coast HideawayIdeal for that next vacation to the heart of California's Lost Coast, this two-story getaway is a terrific option for those looking to hit the beaches or hike the trails! It is spacious, isolated, nestled in tall trees, and provides a serene escape from the modern world. Inside, discover a well-equipped kitchen, a dining table with plenty of seating for mealtimes or game nights, and two comfortably-furnished living areas. Outside, dine al fresco in the gazebo or check out the view from the upper balcony. You can often see deer, foxes, eagles, and a variety of other birds just looking out of the window. In the garage game room, you'll find a Ping-Pong table for when you're craving a little friendly competition.

Shelter Cove offers breathtaking natural beauty that only the most undeveloped parts of the California coastline can provide. It is a perfect place for those looking to walk the rugged shorelines, enjoy peaceful beaches like the Black Sands Beach, explore the rich tide pools next to the lighthouse, hike the Kings Range’s steep mountain trails, or simply relax in nature. For food, we recommend the delicious, locally caught fish at Mi Mochima or the Deli’s unforgettable fish and chips. Gyppo Ale Mill also offers locally brewed beer and a good variety of seasonal entrees. You may also get live Dungeness crabs and fish from local fishermen.

THINGS TO KNOW
Cell service and WiFi can be spotty due to the remote location.
Double sofa bed included.
Guests can enjoy the use of an electric fireplace in the upstairs living room, a Celestron telescope, two yoga mats, two bear cans, camping chairs, left-handed golf clubs, and fishing gear.
Two tri-fold six-inch twin floor mattresses are available for guest use.
TV streaming services require guest accounts to access.

description: Delightful duplex, close to restaurants, beaches, golf and hiking trails!
name: Home in Whitethorn
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Vacasa California6 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 4 beds ·  · 1.5 baths
number of guests: 6 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 4 beds · **__** · 1.5 baths
more description:
The spaceSteelhead CourtTranquility and adventure await you at this delightful townhouse style duplex apartment, only a short distance from the ocean, golf course and runway, perfect for an idyllic romantic getaway, family bonding or just to hang out. The well-equipped kitchen is perfect for preparing a home cooked meal served at the ample dining table or you can head over to one of the nearby eating establishments. The 2 upstairs bedrooms boast peek-a-boo ocean, runway and golf course views, and are furnished with Queen- and Twin-sized beds. The cozy living room has a 50” flat screen, smart TV, including Direct TV and WiFi internet. And a full sized washer and dryer are available for your convenience.

Enjoy the enchanting Lost Coast tucked away from the rat race of the world. Listen to the pounding surf and barking sea lions in the distance. Deer abound and you might even see an occasional fox scamper by. Close by restaurants, coffee shop, brewery / ale house, camp ground, art gallery, and market add to the convenient location. Enjoy hiking trails and nearby tide pools. And watch the sunset over the ocean from one of the close by little park areas that are perched on the ocean’s edge.

THINGS TO KNOW
This is a quiet neighborhood for someone seeking a retreat environment (absolutely no loud people or parties). 
 No dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.Parking notes: There is free parking for 4 vehicles. Parking in driveway and at end of culdesac. Do not park in front of neighbor.County permit number:EXEMPTCounty tax number:013597

description: Up on the hills Cabin, spectacular views
name: Cabin in Garberville
unit rental details: Entire cabin hosted by Aida5 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 3 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 5 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 3 beds · **__** · 1 bath
more description: Situated on 40 acres hillside, our solar-powered off-grid cabin presents gorgeous views of King Range. Quite, private, and relaxing getaway will be memorable with birds, crickets, and frogs all around making themselves heard.The spaceThe Cabin is secluded on almost 40 acres in the coastal mountains on a beautiful hillside hidden behind old Oaks, with a middle-of-nowhere, up above the clouds appeal. It is around 7 miles out of Garberville, the last 1 ½ miles is on a private well-maintained dirt road. All wheel drive or SUV is recommended. Built in 70s and recently remodeled, the house offers a contemporary open-floor design, high ceilings and skylights for plenty of natural light. Downstairs includes a kitchen, dining area, living room, and two large decks. Upstairs there is two open rooms, one bedroom, and a loft each with queen beds.  The full kitchen includes granite counters, new cabinets and modern appliances: range, oven, full refrigerator/freezer. China set for eight, glassware, cups, silverware, pots, pans and utensils are available. There's plenty of counter prep space. The living room has amazing views, a wood stove fireplace, and an alcove. This open space is ideal for working, entertaining and relaxation.The bedroom presents a luxurious queen bed with very comfortable, high quality, medium-firm mattress. There's a dresser and a night stand. The second bedroom/loft has a queen bed with a medium/plush firmness mattress. Also, there is a dresser and a closet with plenty of shelving. The third spare twin bed is downstairs tucked in semi-private area. All beds have soft and luxurious fitted 300-thread count Brooklinen's Egyptian cotton sheets.The bathroom has old woods charm, custom made windows, the shower is in a claw foot tub fitted with a handheld shower head and requires some agility to get in and out. It is simple, with wood floors. Our water comes from a gravity fed spring and can have some natural sediments after the rain. For your convenience, there is a laundry room, and plenty off-street parking on our driveway.The cabin has a cat door!!!

description: ★BlackSands at Shelter Cove- luxury vacation house
name: Home in Whitethorn
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Katie12 guests ·  · 4 bedrooms ·  · 11 beds ·  · 3 baths
number of guests: 12 guests · **__** · 4 bedrooms · **__** · 11 beds · **__** · 3 baths**__**Joined in June 2019**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: Blacksands at Shelter Cove is an amazing retreat for your next family trip!  The house is located 1/2 mile from the famous Black Sands Beach on the lost coast. * Gourmet Kitchen* Great Room with 20-foot ceilings* Movie Theatre/ game room- 3D/ HD 130 inch screen, immersive surround sound, also a 65 inch TV + ping pong + darts.* Stamped Concrete floors with the radiant floor heating *4  Bedrooms- 11 beds* Hottub* Great fenced back yard- turf, covered patio.* 7 TVs! * WiFi * Spa-like bathThe spaceBlackSands at Shelter Cove is located 1/2 mile from the famous Black Sands beach on the Lost Coast. This is a great house for multiple families to enjoy their time in Shelter Cove. The house is a pet-friendly house with a unique backyard for them to run around. Here are the top 10 reasons families will LOVE BlackSands1. You will love to explore the four levels of the house. There is plenty of space to spread out, and the great room is perfect for gathering. The island can seat seven people + 5 dining table + 8 person table. The Great Room has power reclining couches seating 6. The layout of the house is perfect for multiple families. 2. You will  LOVE the seven-person hot tub enjoying the peaceful views of the woods.3. You will  LOVE the bunk room. Whether playing games, watching a movie, or drawing on the chalkboard. It's great to take all the kids and put them in one room. 4. You will love the Movie theatre /game room. Why?? 65-inch tv, 130-inch 3D movie screen for movie night, dartboard, ping pong, movies, games, and the chalkboard. This room has an Immersive surround sound for music and movies 5. You will love hiking to Black Sand beach 6. Your kids will love to play in the back yard. The artificial turf looks like grass but not. It is soft and clean, so your kiddos don't get all dirty.7. You will love the art room to paint and draw or create an abalone/ shell wall art. 8.  You will enjoy going to the tide pools and beaches. Collecting abalone shells, which you can see displayed all over the house, is a favorite activity for our children. You can make all sorts of craft projects with the shells. 9. You will love watching movies in the great room with an extensive 75” TV and impressive seven-speaker in-wall surround sound system. 10. You will enjoy hiking the Lost Coast trail from Black Sands beach or walking through the redwood forest.More info about the house:The house faces the south, so it gets direct sunlight for most of the day.  The house is newly constructed and finished in Jan of 2020.  The architectural style is unique, in that it is built almost entirely of concrete with 12-inch walls and stamped concrete radiant heated floors. The house has four levels and 3350ft2. We are about 300 feet above sea level, and 1/2 mile from the water, which is just far enough from the water to have a safe place for kids to play and you get better weather (more sun, less wind, and fog), but you can still hear the sounds of the waves below. You are surrounded by a beautiful view of fir trees and lush green vegetation from the wetland that extends in the back of the property.  As you pull up to the house, you will see the entrance and a patio to the right. Some stairs take you to the main level and front door. You can also enter the house on the 4th level, which is a Movie theatre/game room. Here is a favorite spot to hang out and enjoy a game of ping pong or throw darts. Also, a floor to ceiling chalkboard is super fun for the kids. The movie theatre screen is 130 inches 3D /HD, and you have fantastic immersive surround sound. We have an assortment of 3D and regular blue rays movies. The system is also connected to DirectTV. There is a second 65 inch TV so that you can watch two games at the same time!You can bring your gaming system and easily connect to either TV with extra HDMI cables.This room can also serve as a 5th bedroom and has a queen futon, and we have two queen air mattresses. This room can sleep 4-6. If used as a bedroom, you can use the front door at the primary level to enter the house. Let’s continue the tour-You enter the central part of the house and descend several stairs to the 3rd level. The house has an open concept, so you are looking down into the great room and see the five massive windows that provide views of the forest and wetland. Overlooking the great room is the desk that is custom made from a slab of Walnut. You will have access to the 27inch mac for any work that you need to do during your stay. You will see many accents, railings, and shelves that are custom made from local hardwoods.  Also, you will see the 25-foot walls in the great room, clad with shiplap. The room has an open, light, and grand feel to it. Going past the desk leads you into the Master Bedroom. Here there are windows with shutters that open to the great room below. Also, a balcony off the master bedroom overlooks the backyard 20 feet below. You can listen to the waves from Black Sands Beach and watch the stars that are fantastically bright on the Lost Coast. The room has a king-size bed and a couch that opens into a queen bed. There is a 55 inch TV, and the room sleeps 4 comfortably. The bathroom ensuite in the master is very lovely with a soaker tub, his and her sinks and a large walk-in shower with a multi soaker shower.The stairs lead down to the main level of the house (level 2). Here you will see the Great Room that features power reclining couches and a 75 inch 4k TV with seven-speaker surround sound. We love to watch movies or listen to music. The sound system is connected to Alexa for voice commands, "Hey Alexa Play Johny Cash." The Kitchen extends the great room and has a massive island that is a favorite spot to watch the chefs cook the fresh catch of the day. The kitchen has all the amenities to cook a great meal. Also the great room as 2 kitchen tables, seating 7-8 at the main and six at the smaller. The total sitting spots, including the coach and island, is over 20. The dining area has a slider that leads to a covered balcony where you will find the BBQ and views of the forest. A spiral staircase just off the side patio will lead you to the back yard and 1st level. Back through the great room leads you past the front door and entryway to the guest room and second bathroom. The bathroom is clad with shiplap and has a bathtub and shower. The guest room has a queen bed with a view of the forest. There is a 55 inch TV. The room has a reading nook that can also serve as a twin bed and can sleep 3. Just to the right of the guest rooms is the linen closet, and adjacent to this is a walk-in pantry. We have a refrigerator here, where we keep our food. The  Kitchen has a pantry and pantry that will be empty for guests. From the main level, you go down to the first floor. There is a small art room where you can get your creative juices flowing. You can paint rocks, a picture, or make a shell board. Right next to the art room is the bunk room. A large barn door separates this bedroom and is an excellent spot for the kids or a family. The room has 2 bunk beds (full on the bottom and twin of the top). There is an entertainment system to watch TV or play movies on a  55 inch TV. The room has a super comfy carpet and a chalkboard on the wall. The sliding door leads you to the backyard witch we will go over in a few. This room sleeps 6.The room next to the bunk room is the 4th bedroom and has a queen bed and another reading nook that can serve as a twin bed. This room also has a 55-inch tv. The sliding door provides excellent views of the backyard and forest. The bathroom on the first level has a shower with multi-panel massage jets. The room adjacent to this is the boiler room. Here is the system that heats the house. The heating system wouldn't usually be something to mention in a rental, but this system is pretty cool. There is over a mile of pex tubing that runs under the stamped concrete floors. There are four zones in the house, each controlled with a Nest thermostat. The feeling of warm floors under your feet is lovely after coming back from a day at the beach. You can control the temperature of the house from the nest app or Alexa. We can remotely turn on the heat to your desired temperature before your arrival. The backyard has a covered stamped concrete patio with a hot tub to relax after a day at the tide pools. Also, a 600 FT2 turf lawn is a great place to enjoy a game of corn hole and is perfect for kids to play around on, without getting dirty. You don’t have the worries of being too close to the water if you have little kids. The grass is enclosed by a fence and is about 4 feet above the wetland. Here are some top things to do in Shelter Cove1. Visit the redwoods. If you are driving from the Bay Area, you can make a stop in Leggett, which has the drive-through tree. Just past Garberville is the Avenue of the Giants. There is also a small grove just past Redway on the way to Shelter Cove. This would be the closest grove to the house, which is about 20 miles; 35-40 min.2. Black Sand Beach- a great place to walk and watch the sunset. Not a swimming beach.3. Shelter Cove Beach- you can drive on this beach at low tide. A recommendation is to check the tides each day and plan accordingly. There are two low tides each day, with one being smaller than the other. We time our beach arrival or tide pools for low tide. This is an excellent beach for swimming, paddleboard, and kayaking. 4. Malcolm Park- this is is the area with the Lighthouse. We like to picnic here, and there is a huge picnic table that can seat 12 people. Take the stairs down to a small beach and tide pools, but check the tides so that you can time your arrival, and you are fortunate is you go on a negative tide. The tide pools extend from Molcoms and north for about 1/2 mile to Abalone point. The tide pools have amazing creatures and seals are all over the place. You can find some tremendous Abalone shells (don’t take live ones); also, you can pull mussels off the rocks and boil with white wine and butter.5. Golf- there is a nine-hole golf course around the runway. There are a couple of sets of old golf clubs that you can use. They are under the stairs. 6. Biking- Paradise Park is Mountain bike park that is about 5 miles up Shelter Cove road. This has single track trails and a bike park with obstacles. You can also ride bikes on the street in front of the house. 7. ATV- people like riding motorcycles and ATVs throughout the town and on the beach. You will see this more on holiday weekends and not so much during a typical week.  If you’ve got one, bring it, and you will enjoy it. 8. Fishing- Shelter cove is a well-known fishing spot. There is room to park a boat in front of the house. You can also charter a fishing boat from a couple of local operators. We have a fishing pole you can use with the kayak. 9. Whale Watching- Whale watching in Shelter Cove peaks in April and May during the grey whale’s migration down the Pacific Coast to warmer waters. You can charter a boat or watch the spouts from any number of picnic spots along the cove.10. Watch the planes land- Shelter Cove has a small runway.  There is no tower, and it’s not monitored. Private pilots will fly to Shelter Cove, which must be awesome. 11. Gyppos- this is our local brewery and restaurant. It overlooks the runway and golf course. They have an outside gas fire pit that is a favorite spot for a cold beer. They have live music and a helpful website that feature the activities for the week. They have corn hole and other games, and the kids can play on the grass around the golf course. 12. Fish Bowl- This is the local coffee shop, and a must-see on your trip. It’s located at the Inn of the Lost Coast. Great coffee and I love the salmon bagel with the works. The owners are super friendly and will give you tips or can connect you with charters or anything else. Autumn knows everyone and knows everything about the cove.13.Delgato Pizza- this is also located at the hotel. You can order a take out pizza from here, or they have a couple of tables outside. They also have baked goods. 14. Sky’s- this is the newest restaurant in the cove. Great tai food and incredible views. This is also a BYOB establishment so that you can save some $$ on your alcohol bill.15. Mi Mochimo- this is a cool Venezuela restaurant that is across from the Hotel. Great deck and unique dishes.

more description: Enjoy the sunrise and sunset over the epic Humboldt county hills. Stay in our off grid homestead set in the Salmon Creek Community, just off the Avenue of the Giants. Near to state parks and the ocean this out of the way stay will be memorable. Fully immersed into the homesteading ways of Southern Humboldt, enjoy the experience of solar power and natural creek water. Take a walk though the woods  and enjoy swimming in our private creek.The spaceThe terrain of the property is steep and can be slippery when wet. Please bring a good pair of walking or hiking shoes.

number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 2 beds · **__** · 1 bath**__**Joined in April 2015**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: Ready for an adventure, escape it all with a vacation to southern Humboldt! Sweet recently built, two bedroom and one bathroom craftsman home with hardwood floors. Located in the eclectic town of Garberville, in a quiet neighborhood.  The house is perfect location, five minute walk to restaurants, shops, bar, natural food store and more!  One hour drive to Shelter Cove on the Lost Coast or one hour to Ferndale and Arcata. Come to explore the Redwoods and experience the culture of Humboldt!The spaceThe house is newly built and features hardwood floors and open kitchen living room area with an island and cafe table to dine at.  There is a coffee maker, (I provide raw sugar and filters) and a coffee grinder for all my whole bean guests;)The house has air conditioning and heat. The living area has a TV with ROKU to watch all your favorite streaming platforms also a DVD player. The first larger bedroom has a king sized bed and small patio through slider doors.  The second bedroom has a queen bed.  Both rooms use only cotton sheets and cotton duvet covers.  Small closets in each room have extra towels, washcloths, blankets and iron.  No need to strip beds or take out trash, we have great help that does everything to clean up after your stay! There is a washer and dryer in the garage for your use as well.  Landscaped small front yard with porch and fully fenced yard with a front gate that can be closed for extra privacy. The driveway holds two vehicles(back out slowly in to the street).

number of guests: 7 guests · **__** · 3 bedrooms · **__** · 4 beds · **__** · 2 baths**__**Joined in April 2018**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: Sea View at Shelter Cove was freshly remodeled in 2018 & decorated with all new furnishings & accessories. The tropical & beach inspired décor compliments the gorgeous ocean view & spacious decks offer sunset views. Find your perfect Lost Coast vacation home here in this beautiful location on a quiet street, with enchanting ocean views.The ocean, golf course, landing strip, nature trails, fishing, surfing, restaurants, & more are within a short walk.The spaceSea View at Shelter Cove was freshly remodeled in 2018. The home features brand new flooring, fresh paint, new vanities, toilets, light fixtures, and all new furnishings and accessories. The tropical and beach inspired décor compliments the gorgeous ocean view the home offers. This single level home includes a spacious living room with sectional sofa, cozy chairs, a gas fireplace, and an ocean view; a master bedroom with queen size bed and attached full bathroom; the "Sandcastle" room which features a bunk bed set with a full size bed on the bottom and twin on the top; the den which has a  fold down futon sofa bed, houses the TV and DVD player, and is stocked with DVDs, books, tons of puzzles, and games; a full guest bathroom with tub and shower; full kitchen with dishes, glasses, flat wear, and pots and pans; a dining room with seating for six, a mud room, and a game room in the garage featuring ping pong and darts. Outdoor living is encouraged with an ample sized back and front decks for sunset views. The ocean, golf course, conveniences, nature trails, and more are within walking distance of this property. Visitors enjoy the local surf spots, black sands beach, fishing, hiking, golfing, and simply relaxing in Shelter Cove. Enjoy activities or simply the peaceful and quiet community that is Shelter Cove. A nearby landing strip accommodates small planes.Notes: WIFI is very limited. Appropriate for checking email and basic browsing. We recommend turning the WIFI calling feature on your cellphone to improve cell reception. Though we can sleep 7 please check that the beds we are providing will be suitable for your needs. For example the bunks are a twin and a full which may be comfortable for 3 children to share but not three adults. The bed in the den is a convertible sofa bed. Please see pictures to ensure these accommodations meet your needs.

description: Ocean View Retreat Deck, Grill, Sauna, Exercise Room, Fireplace, & Free WiFi
name: Home in Whitethorn
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Vacasa California4 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 4 beds ·  · 3 baths
number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 4 beds · **__** · 3 baths
more description:
The spaceHappy Hill RetreatFind solitude and adventure in California's Lost Coast at this beautiful, two-bedroom retreat. Boasting whitewater ocean views and accommodations to sleep four adults comfortably, plus two child-friendly options, this home is the perfect option for a family getaway. Enjoy a private setting with walkable access to to the beach. Lounge in the hammock on the expansive deck or fire up the private gas grill for a barbecue with an unforgettable view. The full-size kitchen comes well-equipped to handle family meals, with stainless steel appliances and utensils. The garage has been converted into a gym/fitness room, including a sauna for ultimate relaxation and luxury after a day exploring the area. Cap off the evening cozied up by the living room fireplace to stream your favorite movies and shows on the flatscreen smart TV.

Great food, drinks, and attractions abound within easy reach of the home. Local standouts include Gyppos Brew House, Mi Mochima, Delgada Pizza, and the Fish Tank. Black Sands Beach and the Lost Coast trail offer world-class hiking and mountain biking. Stop by Briceland Winery for a glass of local wine before heading back home.

Things to Know
WiFi
​​Streaming available with Amazon Fire Stick
A surfboard, golf clubs and fishing gear are provided for guest use No dog(s) are welcome in this home. No other animals are allowed without specific Vacasa approval.Parking notes: There is free parking for 4 vehicles. Parking is located in the driveway. Boat is not for guest use.Damage waiver: The total cost of your reservation for this Property includes a damage waiver fee which covers you for up to $3,000 of accidental damage to the Property or its contents (such as furniture, fixtures, and appliances) as long as you report the incident to the host prior to checking out. More information can be found from the "Additional rules" on the checkout page.Other permit number:EXEMPTCounty tax number:12926

description: Redwood Castle Mendocino retreat
name: Guest suite in Leggett
unit rental details: Entire guest suite hosted by Penelope4 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 2 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 2 beds · **__** · 1 bath
more description: Relax in our 2 bedroom apartment  mins from the giant Redwoods and the Drive  thru tree park, Granite kitchen, microwave,(no oven)  soaking tub & dark Sky's . private apartment below house that opens out to a stone wall garden. Gateway to the Redwoods, Standish-Hickey State  park (hiking & swimming), Richardson grove , Gomde Buddhists center, the hog farm , mins to pacific HWY 1 to mendocino coastNo pet fee, outdoor smoking areaNo TV good internetThe spaceBuilt in 1938 as a cafe, bar and motel  we have spent over 26 years rebuilding this grand road house, The Redwood Castle’s pet friendly 2 bed guest apartment is now-open to short term stays, the apartment  has Granite  countertops , a chiefs kitchen, microwave , (no oven) comfortable beds, cotten linen and a soaking tub! The apartment opens up to a tranquil stone walled garden.we can offer self check  but prefer to meet guests when they arrive for a short briefing  (particularly when u have pets) to make you stay comfortable at the The Redwood castle .(Either myself, my husband or father will greet  you as we all live on the property)  two cozy bedrooms with 1  queen size bed and a double in the second bedroom, its a compact apartment so 3-4 people maximum . We have other listings going on line soon if their are larger groups in need of more space . The design of this apartment makes it cool in summer months and warm in the winter thanks to stone floors and 15 inch thick walls. (no need for air conditioning)We hope our guests will enjoy our space as much as we have over the years. we also have a Lovely gardens to walk in with over 2 acres of flowers and abundant fruit.1/2 mile to  Drive thru tree park, Standish-Hickey State Recreation Area the gateway to the world-famous redwood belt along California’s North Coast. 12 miles to Richardson grove state part , 35 miles to the Avenue of the giants Humboldt Redwoods State Park, and a few hours north is the Humboldt National park.The coast is around a 35 min drive on hwy 1We have WiFi but no TV , Incredible Dark sky’s make this a wonderful place to recharge and bath in star light. We are owner’s of  an art and framing Gallery locally so we are in the process of setting up the walls of The Redwood Castle as its own mini gallery with much of the art on display for sale, we can pack & ship to your home if your interested in buying some art.Our space is eco friendly as we strive to create a sustainable oasis in this busy world .We are dog & cat  friendly and welcome  house trained  dogs please reach out with info about your dog and send a photo . We can coincide well behaved larger dogs , No aggressive  breed's  we keep small dogs & cats on our land.  any damage from dogs will be charge to the guest.  The apartment is NOT fully fenced.. Pets..  But Across from the space we have a meadow  that is fully fenced so dogs and humans can play , we also have a net set up a for  badminton  (we can loan out our 4 rackets )..  we ask you clean up after the doggy guest, and kitty’s need to be litter trained! Other pets please enquire we have options…and love pets..we do not take booking from guests under 21…

description: Cozy Cabin by the River

more description: Kick back and relax in our cozy home on the Lost Coast. It features a fun outdoor space with grill station, fire pit, hammock, and table tennis. It's a short walk to the Mattole River where you can take a dip in the clear water, bask in the sun, take a spin on the paddle board, or cast a fly.  The home is centrally located with easy access to the town of Petrolia, the Lost Coast Trail, King Range National Conservation Area, and Humboldt Redwoods State Park.The spaceOur space is small, clean, and cozy and lots of fun. It is set up for those that love to cook, inside and out. The backyard is where we spend most of our time. Play a board game on the deck or some lawn games under the big Mattole sky, stargaze on the hammock at night while roasting some marshmallows on the fire, or play a late night game of table tennis with some mellow beats. We provide beach chairs, beach towels, a paddle board, and a beach cart for hanging down at the river. There are also a couple of bikes for cruising the neighborhood. We have so many great memories raising our two sons on the Mattole and hope you can continue to create more!

more description: Welcome to the Redwood Forest! Where they say location is everything! You are going to love being within walking distance to great restaurants, bars, groceries, convenience stores, post office, hardware stores, gas stations, river trails, and park. You will be in the heart of the Redwood forest close to the entrance of Avenue of Giants, Humboldt Redwoods state park, Shelter Cove. Come and discover nearby sightseeing, wander the scenic north coast, or explore the redwoods just outside your room.The spaceThis is a newly remodeled Inn close to great sights. It is a no frills simple motel off the highway 101. The Inn does not have a sign, but it stands out with it's salmon pink doors. It's a clean yet rustic place to rest until your next adventure.Our newly remodeled rooms offers: * King bed sleeps 2 * Private bathroom* plush premium mattresses* refrigerator* microwave* in room coffee* heating and air conditioning* free wireless internet* free parking* alarm clock and radio* flat Screen Cable TV* 275 sq. ft.

more description: Romantic 800 square feet space sleeps 2 guests in elegance with sweeping views of the ocean and mountains from its own private deck. Wake up to the sounds and sight of the ocean from your California king canopy bed. Oversized luxurious whirlpool soaking tub, coupled with a multi-jet walk-in shower with seating area, inspires a relaxing spa experience. Includes a bistro table, loveseat, wet bar, plush bedding, and high-quality towels with an array of complimentary bath products. Pet friendlyThe spaceThe master suite rental includes the Sleeping Loft/Game Room and sleeps up to 6 guests. Both rooms are located on the 3rd floor and easily accessible with the home elevator.Amenities:King-sized canopy bed, dressers, nightstands, bistro table & chairs, love seat & coffee table and end of the bed benchDouble sinks, multi-jet walk-in shower, over-size whirlpool bathtub with shampoo, conditioner, body wash & various toiletriesWood burning stove & in-floor radiant heating80 sq. ft. walk-in closet with built-in shelving and storagePet friendly (see House Rules for details)Fenced back yard & exotic garden with fire pitStarlink high speed internet access with Wi-FiEquipped with a 55" smart TV that includes Netflix, ESPN+, Roku & DVD playerAccess to library with a large selection of books & DVDsWet bar with small sink and 4.5 cu. ft. compact refrigeratorSmall appliances include microwave, electric kettle, 4-cup drip coffee maker, french press and fresh gourmet coffee & filtersStocked with a variety of herbal teas, snacks, salt & pepper and bone china with flatwareBarbeque grill access (2nd floor deck)

description: VISIT THE REDWOODS  - STUDIO WITH QUEEN BED
name: Hotel room in Redway
unit rental details: Room in hotel hosted by Gary2 guests ·  · Studio ·  · 1 bed ·  · 1 private bath
number of guests: 2 guests · **__** · Studio · **__** · 1 bed · **__** · 1 private bath
more description: Welcome to the Redwood Forest! Where they say location is everything! You are going to love being within walking distance to great restaurants, bars, groceries, convenience stores, post office, hardware stores, gas stations, river trails, and park. You will be in the heart of the Redwood forest close to the entrance of Avenue of Giants, Humboldt Redwoods state park, Shelter Cove. Come and discover nearby sightseeing, wander the scenic north coast, or explore the redwoods just outside your room.The spaceThis is a newly remodeled Inn close to great sights. It is a no frills simple motel off the highway 101. The Inn does not have a sign, but it stands out with it's salmon pink doors. It's a clean yet rustic place to rest until your next adventure.Our newly remodeled rooms offers: * Queen bed sleeps 2 * Private bathroom* plush premium mattresses* refrigerator* microwave* in room coffee* heating and air conditioning* free wireless internet* free parking* alarm clock and radio* flat Screen Cable TV* 275 sq. ft.Guest accessThere is an onsite manager that manages the property. Upon arrival there is a dedicated parking lot for guests. Once you park, walk to the lobby door where you 'RING A DOORBELL'. The Ring Camera doorbell will ring the onsite manager who will give you a room key. Also, we can leave the key in a lockbox, and give you the code for a later than expected arrival. We will text or email you DOOR CODE instructions.

description: Glamping in the Redwoods:  Farm Stay, Orchard site
name: Tent in Garberville
unit rental details: Tipi hosted by Ana2 guests ·  · 1 bedroom ·  · 1 bed ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 2 guests · **__** · 1 bedroom · **__** · 1 bed · **__** · 1 bath
more description: Our small family farm invites you to camp in luxury under a canopy of redwoods. Located just 10 mins outside of Garberville in a redwood valley, we offer two glamping sites that have everything you need to enjoy nature in style. One of the sites is called The Orchard. You can drive your car right up to it. The other requires climbing stairs to the top of a hill. We call that one The Knoll. This page describes The Orchard site. See my other listings to view more info on The Knoll.The spaceThe Orchard Site features a carpeted 16 foot round tent with a queen size bed with all linens, pillows blankets, as well as a couch, coffee table, drawers for clothing, and solar powered lights both inside and outside. It has a small outdoor kitchenette with a 2-burner stove, pots, pans, coffee, tea, and a 5-gallon water jug. Enjoy your meals on a large outdoor table nestled under a shade awning. Plates, glasses and cutlery are provided. There is a cooler, a compost bin for your food scraps, porto-potty service and a hand washing station. For showering, feel free to use our gorgeous hand made spiral outdoor shower, and then relax under the stars in our 5 person hot tub!

We provide three garbage cans for your garbage.

more description: Welcome to the Redwood Forest! Where they say location is everything. You are going to love being within walking distance to great restaurants, bars, groceries, convenience stores, post office, hardware stores, gas station, river trails, and park. You will be in the heart of the Redwood forest close to the entrance of Avenue of Giants, Humboldt Redwoods state park, Shelter Cove. Come and discover nearby sightseeing, wander the scenic north coast, or explore the redwoods just outside your room.The spaceThis is a newly remodeled Inn close to great sights. It is a no frills simple motel off the highway 101. The Inn does not have a sign, but it stands out with it's salmon pink doors. It's a clean yet rustic place to rest until your next adventure.Our newly remodeled rooms offers: * Two QUEEN BEDS SLEEPS UP TO 4 * Private bathroom* plush premium mattresses* refrigerator* microwave* in room coffee* heating and air conditioning* free wireless internet* free parking* alarm clock and radio* flat Screen Cable TV * 275 sq. ft.

name: Cabin in Myers Flat
unit rental details: Entire cabin hosted by Giant Redwoods4 guests ·  · Studio ·  · 3 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · Studio · **__** · 3 beds · **__** · 1 bath
more description: Camp without the tent! Serene environment for remote workers in need of a change of scenery & some redwood therapy! Fiber optic WiFi. Brand new "Glamping" cabins which do not have plumbing inside. You'll be assigned your own private bathroom. Pack like you're tent camping, but leave the tent at home! Inside is charming. There's a queen bed, bunk beds, a loveseat, kitchen table set, A/C, fan, electric fireplace, Flat Screen Smart TV, Mini fridge, Microwave/Convection Oven & Coffee MakerThe space"Glamping" cabins are 11ft by 20ft dimensions plus a covered deck with 2 chairs. You have your own outdoor space with a picnic table and fire ring with grill where you can BBQ or bring your campstove/hibachi if you like. There are also outlets located on the deck for outdoor remote working with serene views. Views from inside the cabins and deck typically look out to trees in the park, many of which are spectacular redwoods.

description: Jessie Benbow’s Room
name: Hotel room in Garberville
unit rental details: Room in boutique hotel hosted by John2 guests ·  · 1 bedroom ·  · 1 private bath
number of guests: 2 guests · **__** · 1 bedroom · **__** · 1 private bath
more description: Welcome to the Benbow Historic Inn, a premiere North Coast Hotel, Golf Course and KOA RV resort located near Garberville – a small town in the heart of California Redwood Country near the Avenue of the Giants. Nestled on the banks of the Eel River in Humboldt County, California. Our resort offers something for everyone seeking a California Redwoods vacation.Enjoy a delicious meal in our fabulous dining room or outdoor dining under the canopy of the redwoods.The spaceAbout This RoomView of back terrace, stone bridge, tree tops. Gas fireplace, desk with outlet and vaulted ceilings.The room includes a king size bed, luxuriously large bathroom with a soaking tub.  A variety of artisan bath bombs, bubble bath, and soaps are available at the gift shop to complete a relaxing night away from home.About Jessie BenbowJessie was the third Benbow child. She was dark and dramatic and left home as soon as she could, living with her musical cousins in Petrolia and performing for guests at the Petrolia hotel. When the family decided to buy the ranch, Jessie and her husband Harold pitched in with all the dirty work, driving tractors, burning bushes, digging trenches. She assisted in the kitchen, at the Front Desk, cleaned rooms, washed laundry, and worked with the seamstresses. She loved the color lavender which will be evident in her room.

description: Glamping Cabins in the Majestic Redwoods - C2
name: Cabin in Myers Flat
unit rental details: Entire cabin hosted by Giant Redwoods4 guests ·  · Studio ·  · 3 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · Studio · **__** · 3 beds · **__** · 1 bath
more description: Camp without the tent! Serene environment for remote workers in need of a change of scenery & some redwood therapy! Fiber optic WiFi. Brand new "Glamping" cabins which do not have plumbing inside. You'll be assigned your own private bathroom. Pack like you're tent camping, but leave the tent at home! Inside is charming. There's a queen bed, bunk beds, a loveseat, kitchen table set, A/C, fan, electric fireplace, Flat Screen Smart TV, Mini fridge, Microwave/Convection Oven & Coffee MakerThe space"Glamping" cabins are 11ft by 20ft dimensions plus a covered deck with 2 chairs. You have your own outdoor space with a picnic table and fire ring with grill where you can BBQ or bring your campstove/hibachi if you like. There are also outlets located on the deck for outdoor remote working with serene views. Views from inside the cabins and deck typically look out to trees in the park, many of which are spectacular redwoods.

description: Earnest Linser’s Room
name: Hotel room in Garberville
unit rental details: Room in hotel hosted by John4 guests ·  · 1 bedroom ·  · 1 bed ·  · 1 private bath
number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · 1 bedroom · **__** · 1 bed · **__** · 1 private bath
more description: Welcome to the Benbow Historic Inn, a premiere North Coast Hotel, Golf Course and KOA RV resort located near Garberville – a small town in the heart of California Redwood Country near the Avenue of the Giants. Nestled on the banks of the Eel River in Humboldt County, California. Our resort offers something for everyone seeking a California Redwoods vacation.Enjoy a delicious meal in our fabulous dining room or outdoor dining under the canopy of the redwoods.The spaceAbout This RoomRoom #406. View of back terrace, stone bridge, and tree tops. Adjoining room option with 407, gas fireplace, desk with outlet, and vaulted ceilings. Standing shower, tub not available.About Earnest LinserEarnest Linser was a prominent Southern Humboldt rancher who ran his family’s ranch near Island Mountain. He then ran the Kinsey ranch (above Benbow) for years before buying the 1288 acre Roberts Ranch in 1914. His daughter Vera married Walter Benbow and Mr. Linser stayed on for years helping the Benbows with the ranch. He was never paid for the land. His room (406) will be adjoining Walter’s (407) and overlooking the ranch and the Kinsey ranch which he ran for years.

number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · 2 beds · **__** · Half-bath
more description: You won’t forget your time in this romantic, memorable place. Situated amongst the Redwoods right on the Eel river, you and your family or partner can enjoy canoeing, swimming, and exploring the old train tracks in a private and safe environment. If you would like to float down the river a bit one day, we will be happy to pick you up! We do have multiple sites, so even if the calendar says it is booked, we may have a spot so feel free to ask!The spaceThis is an area with several possible camping sites for guests to pitch their own or our tents (2x double capacity) and sleeping pads, depending on the taste of the guest. There are no amenities other than access to a clean outhouse, a 8x12 platform to set up a tent or bed, and access to clean drinking water

No TV. Located in Historical Building.

description: Views, Luxury, Hot Tub -- Above the Clouds I
name: Home in Moretown
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Marianne7 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 4 beds ·  · 2 baths
number of guests: 7 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 4 beds · **__** · 2 baths**__**Joined in June 2013**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: COMPLETE COVID-19 CLEANING Magnificent home, stunning views, extensive gardens, total serenity. Complete luxury: hot tub, fireplace & wood stove, outdoor dining w/ hummingbirds, massage & hammock chairs, spa-quality baths w/ jacuzzi & shower w/ 5 heads, gourmet kitchen, original artwork. Near VT's premier skiing, hiking, & outdoor adventures w/ 180+ view of VT's most majestic mountains. Perfect for summer vacations, stunning autumn foliage & ski retreats.The spaceLuxuriate in the serene elegance of Above the Clouds I -- relax in the travertine showers (one with 5 shower heads!), 2-person jacuzzi, or outdoor hot tub that faces west across the Mad River Valley; prepare a gourmet meal in a true cook’s kitchen outfitted with every appliance imaginable or use the Traeger wood pellet grill on the side patio; pamper yourself in the massage chair and hammock chair while watching a fire in the fireplace or woodstove (or both!); stroll through the extensive gardens; take a nap in the hammock; eat blueberries fresh off the bush; relax on the deck at sunset while sipping wine and watching hummingbirds wiz by... Though Above the Clouds is close to many of Vermont’s premier tourist destinations, there’s so much deliciousness here that there’s no need to go anywhere else!Located at the end of a quarter-mile-long driveway that passes through birch and hemlock woods you'll find yourself perched at the top of the world overlooking a glorious 180+degree mountain vista. Other than the adjacent guesthouse (located nearby but placed so both homes have privacy), the only signs of life are lights twinkling across the valley at night and the wildlife that shares the land and soars over the valley. Or, if you’re looking for accommodations for a larger party, rent both homes and sleep up to 13 people (click my host picture to see my other listing or see the listing for Above the Clouds II and Above the Clouds Retreat).Huge windows with amazing views grace every room in this 2500+ s.f. house and make the boundaries between the glorious outdoors and sumptuous indoors hard detect. With two sleeping wings (each with an en-suite, luxurious bathroom), two couples or a family of five can visit by day yet have complete privacy at night. Two more people can sleep in the cozy upper living room on a queen bed that pulls out of the leather sofa. Every room in the house is enhanced by original artwork, and all the fixings are the finest (cherry bedroom furnishings, sheepskin rugs and accents, TempurPedic mattresses, luxurious throws, leather furnishings, down blankets and pillows, etc.). The kitchen is a gourmet chef’s dream with a gas range, huge pantry decked out with every appliance imaginable (plus some more!), generous granite counters, a giant array of spices, and a Traeger wood pellet grill/smoker on the adjacent patio. The delectables you create can be eaten on the patio table that seats up to 8, in the dining room on the table that can seat up to 12, or in the cozy octagonal breakfast nook. Perhaps the best part is that there is an amazing view from every seat in the house. For your entertainment, the 65" Samsung The Frame smart TV displays photos (most of which are nature shots that were taken by Bob) when not in use has access to most major streaming services as well as Samsung's television channels. There is a Bose bluetooth speaker for your digital music. For some old-fashioned fun, there is a generous store of books, puzzles, and board and lawn games. The gardens are as glorious as the inside of the house. If you can extract yourself from the cedar deck and patio furniture or 6-person hot tub, you'll want to wander and enjoy the extensive perennial gardens, relax by the water garden with fountain, play games on the lawns, or head off to hike on our 20 acres and adjacent trails. Seasonally, a dozen mature blueberry bushes and organic veggie and herb gardens can round out your dining selection. And, of course, no country holiday could be complete without a hammock and fire pit...Both houses are powered by the sun and we offer a complimentary Level 2 EV charging station.Up to 2 dogs may be permitted. Prior approval and a $250 pet cleaning fee are required.Contact me to discuss our seasonal rental rate. Heated garage space available for bookings of one month or more.

description: Dramatic Views at Above the Clouds II
name: Home in Moretown
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Marianne6 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 2 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 6 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 2 beds · **__** · 1 bath**__**Joined in June 2013**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: As featured in Conde Nast Traveler (1/21/22)Peaceful & uplifting impeccable home w/ 180-view of VT's tallest mountains. Near VT's premier skiing, hiking, outdoor adventures. Sunset views, breathtaking vistas, calming atmosphere, artful aesthetic, attention to detail. Sumptuous deck furniture, outdoor shower, fire pit, & garden patio extend the summer experience. Fireplace, sheepskin rugs & indoor ski storage are perfect for ski retreats. COMPLETE COVID-19 CLEANING & SELF-CHECK-IN.The spaceAbove the Clouds, a stand-alone guesthouse with private entrance, was built with attention to every detail and a commitment to creating a peaceful, uplifting environment. While you're likely to travel to Vermont to partake in its natural beauty and outdoor adventures it's so lovely here that you may never want to leave.Located at the end of a quarter-mile-long driveway that passes through birch and hemlock woods you'll find yourself perched at the top of the world overlooking a 180+degree mountain vista. Other than the adjacent main house (located nearby but placed so both houses have privacy), the only signs of life are lights twinkling across the valley at night and the wildlife that shares the land and soars over the valley.The 1000+ square foot open-concept second story can sleep up to four, while the 250+ sf main room downstairs can sleep another two. Upstairs the hand-crafted wooden headboard, made from local maple, is a one-of-a-kind work of art that creates privacy for the queen-size master bed. It is situated so it has incredible views of the surrounding mountains and enjoys morning sunrises and evening sunsets. At the opposite end of the room, the reading nook has a sheepskin-covered daybed that can be separated into two twins or turned into a king-sized bed at night. The couch in the lower living room converts into a comfortable queen-size bed (plus a memory foam topper for those who want it). Though the room downstairs is only separated by the staircase, the downstairs sleeping area is private because of the layout of the house. All bed linens, towels, and pillows are hotel quality with both down and non-down options.Our spa-like bathroom has a shower large enough for two with both rainfall and hand-held showerheads, plus a pebble floor to massage your feet. The sink is made from a hand-carved boulder and sits atop a spalted maple live-edge counter held up by a birch tree base harvested from our property. The skylight overlooking the adjacent forest top fills the room with light. The live-edge wood sliding door is so beautiful you'll want to hug it. You have to experience it to understand... For those who want to bathe in the midst of Vermont's great outdoors, there is an outdoor shower that affords complete privacy and absolutely amazing views. The kitchen, with Euro-fridge and dishwasher, is equipped with gourmet appliances, including a fondue pot for a leisurely dining treat. There are incredible views from every window and a beautiful granite counter surrounded by comfortable leather bar stools.The living room, with views in every direction, adjoins an 8'x20' deck with clear walls, providing an amazing place for outdoor living high up in the trees. During warm weather, sleep under the stars on the sumptuous deck furniture; BBQ, dine, and use the firepit on the garden patio.  For your entertainment, the TV is hooked up to DirecTV and has a Roku and DVD player. There is a high-quality Bluetooth speaker for your digital music. For some old-fashioned fun, there is a generous store of board games, books, and puzzles.Both houses are powered by the sun and have high-speed fiber-optic internet (500 mbps up and down). We offer a complimentary Level 2 EV charging station.Note: On a limited basis, the main house -- Above the Clouds I -- can also be rented on a stand-alone basis or you can rent both homes to use for larger groups. For more information about the main house or renting both homes see the Airbnb listings linked with my profile. Please note, that while we rarely rent the houses to two unrelated parties at the same time, we may occasionally do this. When this happens, we introduce the families to each other and do our best to make sure everyone understands the need to respect each others' privacy and the importance of keeping it peaceful here. The houses are oriented in different directions, so this is an easy thing to do.

more description: A quiet and cozy lower level studio apartment located on Route 100 in Moretown.   Just 20-25 minutes away from the Mad River Valley (Sugarbush, Mount Ellen, and Mad River Glen) in one direction and Waterbury in the other.The spaceEnjoy your morning cup of coffee outside under the covered porch.  A Keurig with K-cups/sugar/creamer are in the kitchen to get you started first thing in the morning.  The kitchen also has a microwave, full refrigerator, full electric stove/oven, dishwasher.  All the basic cooking tools, utensils and dishes.   A full washer/dryer share the kitchen space.Easy access to all of Central Vermont including: Bolton Valley Ski Area (30 min),  Stowe (30 min), Stowe Mountain Resort (45 min) , and Montpelier (25 min).

description: Launch your epic vacation from the Zenbarn!
name: Apartment in Waterbury Center
unit rental details: Entire rental unit hosted by Ari4 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 2 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 2 beds · **__** · 1 bath**__**Joined in January 2014**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: PLEASE READ FULL DESCRIPTION BEFORE BOOKING!  This two bedroom unit has great mountain views and is centrally located between Waterbury and Stowe.  It is an ideal base camp for beer geeks, skiers, mountain bikers or anyone looking to experience the best Vermont has to offer.  It is located above Zenbarn - a very hip farm to table restaurant with lots of live music and an amazing Vermont Beer tap list and cocktails featuring the best Vermont distillers.The spaceDISCLAIMER:  At the risk of sounding rude please remember I don't need you to book this place.  I've been doing airbnb for almost a decade.  Ive found cool laid back travelers with a sense of adventure absolutely love my place and this accounts for 95% of my guests.  My life has become increasingly busy(2 business', two toddlers, multiple airbnbs) and help increasingly hard to find and my tolerance for nit picky guests who are gonna freak out over a stray hair, a tattered corner on a sheet or some other minor inconvenience is pretty much gone.   If you have an issue when you arrive by all means let me know and I will bend over backwards to resolve it but I'd love to find a way to get rid of the needy/whiney guest who ends up stressing me out and making me wish I didn't do Airbnb.  Remember this whole thing started with a guy renting out his couch in San Francisco for a few extra bucks.  If you love walking in to a hotel room and getting exactly what you expect I reccomend staying at one of the many awesome local hotels that would love your business.  If your just looking for a dope pad to crash and experience our cool little town come drink some beers and catch an awesome show or two  then please book with  me!  Location, location, location.  Easily access Stowe, Burlington and the Mad River Valley as well as all of Waterbury's great destinations like Ben and Jerry's, Cider Mill, and our great food scene.  The Apartment is tastefully decorated with really nice furniture, a full Kitchen with all the basics and cool decorations including an old Pinball Machine and Jukebox (sadly both our currently out of order).  There is another two bedroom apartment upstairs and the whole place can be combined into a 5 bedroom apartment.DISCLAIMER: The apartment - especially one of the bedrooms shares a wall with the restaurant so when there is live music it can be very loud.  Most of our shows are Thurs, Fri or Saturday and often over by midnight but shows can go later.  I provide ear plugs and no guarantees beyond that.  I have had hundreds of people stay in the apartment over the past couple years (I have it listed as a five bedroom space utilizing both floors as well) and only a few have complained about the noise.  So I'll leave it up to you to decide if you can live with it or not :)

Separate entrance with self check-in through the garage, no steps necessary. 25 minutes from downtown, 25 minutes from first ski resort (Bolton).High speed internet, TV with HBO/Amazon/Netflix/Hulu, heat/air-conditioning, and other basic amenities available (e.g. coffee, microwave, mini fridge/freezer, Drinkworks machine). All the basic amenities you could need: mini fridge/freezer, microwave, Keurig (coffee/hot water), and Drinkworks machine. The TV is set up with Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, and HBO. High-speed internet. Cot or air mattress available upon request for extra guests.Full-sized bathroom with bathtub shower and washer/dryer. Shower has shampoo, conditioner, and body wash.Parking is available in the driveway. No steps are necessary to enter the unit.

The character and local vibes with the exposed beams and cathedral ceilings will not disappoint.  The large private deck is a favorite spot to enjoy the sunshine and the natural beauty that surrounds this private home.    ALL 3 SKI RESORTS within 5 miles- MadRiverGlen, Sugarbush North & South!!! This place has "Cozy" written everywhere you look to make you feel right at home.   The master suite has a queen size memory foam mattress with a private half bath.   The second bedroom offers private views of the large lawn and private woods.  Third bedroom available for larger groups with 3 additional twin size beds.  Enjoy a BBQ on the deck with the gas grill or a home cooked meal in the fully stocked kitchen.  Wifi and Cable TV.

description: Basecamp Waterbury - center of it all!
name: Apartment in Waterbury Center
unit rental details: Entire rental unit hosted by Ari4 guests ·  · 2 bedrooms ·  · 3 beds ·  · 1 bath
number of guests: 4 guests · **__** · 2 bedrooms · **__** · 3 beds · **__** · 1 bath**__**Joined in January 2014**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: PLEASE READ FULL DESCRIPTION BEFORE BOOKING - and I prefer a message over instant book just to make sure you don't have any questions and I don't have any conflicts.  You can't get more centrally located to everything Vermont has to offer.  5 minutes to downtown Waterbury, 10 minutes to Stowe, Half an hour to Burlington or Mad River.  There is a shared hallway entry with the downstairs apartment but only the one exterior door in common.The spaceDISCLAIMER:  At the risk of sounding rude please remember I don't need you to book this place.  I've been doing airbnb for almost a decade.  Ive found cool laid back travelers with a sense of adventure absolutely love my place and this accounts for 95% of my guests.  My life has become increasingly busy(2 business', two toddlers, multiple airbnbs) and help increasingly hard to find and my tolerance for nit picky guests who are gonna freak out over a stray hair, a tattered corner on a sheet or some other minor inconvenience is pretty much gone.   If you have an issue when you arrive by all means let me know and I will bend over backwards to resolve it but I'd love to find a way to get rid of the needy/whiney guest who ends up stressing me out and making me wish I didn't do Airbnb.  Remember this whole thing started with a guy renting out his couch in San Francisco for a few extra bucks.  If you love walking in to a hotel room and getting exactly what you expect I reccomend staying at one of the many awesome local hotels that would love your business.  If your just looking for a dope pad to crash and experience our cool little town come drink some beers and catch an awesome show or two  then please book with  me!  This iconic barn was once a working Dairy barn that was converted into a wooden toy factory in the 60's. It then became an iconic ski restaurant in the 70's and operated with acclaim for 40 years. I purchased and started renovating the space in 2015. Everyone is blown away by how spacious this place is. 2 Huge bedrooms with high quality queen size beds. Each room feature sky lights and all have spacious closets. There is a large living room  with a apt size fridge, 20” range and stainless counter and sink for preparing meals.  There is  flat screen TV for streaming your favorite shows. The small balcony has great views of sunrise and the Worcester  mountains.  We have a restaurant and yoga/wellness studio under the apartment and you get a discount to both if you mention you are an Airbnb guest. Noise can be an issue but ear plugs are an easy solution if music bothers you at night and we work hard to accommodate everyone to ensure a wonderful stay and during covid we have nothing planned besides occasional solo artists. The property is adjacent to one of the top golf courses in the state and you can walk along the community path to down town Waterbury. Takes about 25 minutes. I keep a few nice mowed trails on my property which is part of an important wild life corridor. You can explore the beautiful thatcher brook and may even be able to pull out a fish or two. In the winter you can put on your xc skis and head right out the door.

description: The Old Horsman Guest House in Moretown Village
name: Home in Moretown
unit rental details: Entire home hosted by Michelle7 guests ·  · 4 bedrooms ·  · 4 beds ·  · 2 baths
number of guests: 7 guests · **__** · 4 bedrooms · **__** · 4 beds · **__** · 2 baths**__**Joined in September 2014**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap**__**Privacy·**__**·Terms·**__**·Sitemap
more description: Spacious 1920's home located in the heart of Moretown Village.  With easy access to local ski areas and the Mad River Valley, yet only 12 minutes from I-89, you'll be ready for any adventure.  Inside you'll find four bedrooms on the second floor, plus two kid-sized bunks in the  recreation space on the third floor.  The first floor has a dedicated exercise room as well as an extra sitting room in the kitchen area.  Outside there is a large timber-framed porch (unscreened) with hot tub.The spaceBuilt by the local lumber mill owner for his family, the house has local maple woodwork and beautiful Craftsman details throughout. A later owner took in boarders in the 1960’s as skiing gained in popularity in the Mad River Valley and around Vermont. There are still the original brass numbers on the bedroom doors.  This is our primary residence, and being empty-nesters, we stay in a self-contained apartment attached to the home when we have guests (unless we are travelling ourselves).  The apartment and the main home are separate so our paths will not typically cross. When we’re gone there will be a local caretaker available when necessary.Being a village home there is some traffic noise now and then but that also means we are on pavement…so getting in and out, even in snow, is not a problem.Parking for 2 cars onsite with parking next door at a town parking lot.  The entire main house is open for the guests to use. Some of the closets may be locked as personal items are stored there.Linens, bath towels, guest shampoo and soap are provided. Please bring your own swimming/hot tub towels.Airbnb’s Vermont Meals and Rooms Tax ID number is MRT-10126712
